revised_title: The Impact of Nitrogen-Fixing Bacteria on the Growth of Non-Leguminous Plants
tldr: The authors investigate the effects of nitrogen-fixing bacteria, specifically Pseudomonas and Azotobacter, on the growth of non-leguminous plants. They find that these bacteria can significantly improve the growth and nitrogen content of plants such as oats, barley, hyacinths, and parsnips when applied directly to their roots.
